title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 ยง 810.3 - Definitions
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 ยง 810.3 - Definitions

State Regulations

As used in this Part: (a) Application means written application for
a grant submitted in a format prescribed by the department. (b) Board means the New York State

Occupational Safety and Health Hazard Abatement Board. (c) Department means the New York State

Department of Labor. (d) Educational institution means any university, college, academy, or other
institution chartered by the Board of Regents under section
216
of the

Education Law, an education corporation formed under the Business Corporation

Law or the Not-for-Profit Corporation Law with the consent of the Commissioner
of Education or a private school licensed pursuant to section
5003
of the

Education Law. (e) Employer means
any public or private individual, partnership, corporation, association or
political subdivision who employs two or more persons. (f) Grants means an award of funds to an
eligible entity for a project authorized under section
810.5
of this Part. (g) Labor organization means any entity which
exists for the purpose, in whole or in part, of representing employees employed
within the State of New York in dealing with public or private employers or
employer organizations concerning terms and conditions of employment or other
matters incidental to the employment relationship, and shall include the
statewide organization of a local labor organization, regional, statewide or
national organizations and associations, federations or councils of labor
organizations. (h) Nonprofit
organization means an agency, association, corporation, institution or other
entity which may not lawfully hold or use any part of its net earnings to the
benefit of any private shareholder or individual and which does not hold or use
its net earnings for that purpose. (i) Program means the training and education
program on occupational safety and health. (j) Trade association means any group which
exists for the purpose, in whole or in part, of representing employers engaged
in a particular trade, business or industry, or different trades, businesses or
industries. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12
ยง
810.3

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
